data.title: Famous Actors From Texas
data.meta_description: Texas has produced a number of Actors who have made it big. Check out this section to know more about them.
data.text:
1

Matthew McConaughey

(One of the Most Versatile and Highest-Grossing Actors of Hollywood)

134

66

Birthdate: November 4, 1969

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Born into a family of mixed ancestry in Texas, actor Matthew McConaughey had an interesting childhood. He played sports as a young boy and aspired to become a lawyer. However, he ultimately changed course to venture into acting, a field where he was able to make a mark with his brilliant performances. He is also a producer.

2

Patrick Swayze

(Best Known For His Roles in the Films: 'Dirty Dancing' and 'Ghost')

88

47

Birthdate: August 18, 1952

Sun Sign: Leo

Died: September 14, 2009

Patrick Swayze, the American actor, dancer, singer and songwriter, was very popular during the 1980s. His movie the ‘Dirty Dancing’ catapulted him to stardom. Ghost was another of his hit films. Swayze died in September, 2009, at the age of 57 due to pancreatic cancer. His final role was that of a FBI Agent in the television series ‘The Beast’.

3

Jamie Foxx

(Best Known for His Portrayal of Ray Charles in the Biopic 'Ray')

132

36

Birthdate: December 13, 1967

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Actor, singer-songwriter, and comedian, Jamie Foxx became internationally famous for his portrayal of Ray Charles in the biographical film Ray, a role that earned him an Academy Award. He is also known for hosting his own television sitcom, The Jamie Foxx Show. Besides acting, he is also a Grammy Award-winning musician who has released four albums.

Recommended Lists:

4

Tommy Lee Jones

(Actor and Director Best Known for His Films: ‘The Fugitive’ and ‘Men in Black’)

72

11

Birthdate: September 15, 1946

Sun Sign: Virgo

Veteran actor and filmmaker, Tommy Lee Jones, has had a career spanning over half a century. he has played many notable roles onscreen and is especially known for portraying real-life characters like businessman Howard Hughes. He has won an Academy Award for his performance in the movie, The Fugitive. Tommy Lee Jones is an inductee to the Texas Cowboy Hall of Fame.

Recommended Lists:

5

Woody Harrelson

(Actor and Playwright)

58

9

Birthdate: July 23, 1961

Sun Sign: Leo

Actor Woody Harrelson has been active in the entertainment world for over 40 years now. The son of a convicted hit-man, he had a difficult childhood and grew up in poverty. However, he was determined to build a good life for himself and earned a BFA in theater before venturing into acting. He is a vegan and an environmental activist.

6

Owen Wilson

(Famous for Starring in Comedies Like ‘The Royal Tenenbaums,’ ‘Wedding Crashers,’ and ‘Zoolander’)

48

15

Birthdate: November 18, 1968

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Comic actor, screenwriter and producer, Owen Wilson has earned praise for acting in movies like Wedding Crashers, Midnight in Paris, Inherent Vice and The Royal Tenenbaums, the last of which he also co-wrote with his long-time friend, Wes Anderson. The charming actor has also lent his voice to animation movies like Fantastic Mr. Fox, Free Birds and Cars film series.

Recommended Lists:

7

Bill Paxton

(Actor and Filmmaker Best Known for His TV Series 'Big Love')

41

9

Birthdate: May 17, 1955

Sun Sign: Taurus

Died: February 25, 2017

Versatile actor, Bill Paxton is recognised for his work in the movies, Apollo 13, Twister and Titanic, as well as the television series, Big Love. Before these, he began his career as a set-dresser, learnt acting under Stella Adler, did various minor roles and finally bagged films like The Terminator and Alien. His work as a director are Frailty and Fish Heads.

8

Jim Parsons

(Actor)

60

11

Birthdate: March 24, 1973

Sun Sign: Aries

In 2018, Jim Parsons was named by Forbes as the world's highest-paid TV actor. His role as Sheldon Cooper in The Big Bang Theory has played a major role in determining his success as a TV actor. Apart from making him rich, the series was also responsible for earning him a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Recommended Lists:

9

Ethan Hawke

(Famous For His Role in 'Before Trilogy')

37

7

Birthdate: November 6, 1970

Sun Sign: Scorpio

American actor, Ethan Hawke, is an acclaimed artist and has had a successful career. His breakthrough role was of a school student in the 1989 film Dead Poets Society. Training Day, First Reformed, Boyhood, Before Sunrise, Before Sunset and Before Midnight are some of his critically appreciated movies. He has also directed several films and acted in many stage productions.

10

Dennis Quaid

(American Actor Best Known for His Dramatic & Comedic Roles)

48

9

Birthdate: April 9, 1954

Sun Sign: Aries

Regarded as one of the best actors to have not received an Oscar nomination by The Guardian, Dennis Quaid is popular for portraying a wide variety of roles. He fought drug addiction early in his career to become a successful actor. He is also a musician and golfer; Golf Digest magazine mentioned him as the top golfer among Hollywood celebrities.

Recommended Lists:

11

Steve Martin

(Actor, Comedian, Writer and Musician)

44

8

Birthdate: August 14, 1945

Sun Sign: Leo

A man of many talents, Steve Martin is a successful comedian, actor, and musician. In 2004, he was ranked sixth in Comedy Central's 100 greatest stand-up comics list. Despite achieving great fame and success as a comedian and actor, Steve decided to pursue a career in music and began appearing seldom in films to record and tour with bluegrass acts.

12

Jensen Ackles

(Best Known for His Role of 'Dean Winchester' in the TV Series 'Supernatural')

37

7

Birthdate: March 1, 1978

Sun Sign: Pisces

Known for his Emmy-nominated performance as Eric Brady in Days of Our Lives, Jensen Ackles had initially wished to study sports medicine. He appeared in the series Supernatural, Dark Angel, and Smallville, and the film My Bloody Valentine 3D. He also voiced Jason Todd in Batman: Under the Red Hood.

Recommended Lists:

13

Forest Whitaker

(Best Known for His Role in 'The Last King of Scotland')

38

9

Birthdate: July 15, 1961

Sun Sign: Cancer

Forest Whitaker is best known for his Academy Award-winning performance as real-life dictator Idi Amin in The Last King of Scotland. Fans also loved him in Rogue One and Ghost Dog. He is an advocate of the UN’s Global Goals and supports peace-building initiatives and programs that help war victims.

14

Jared Padalecki

(Best Known for His Role as ‘Sam Winchester’ in the TV Series ‘Supernatural’)

34

8

Birthdate: June 19, 1982

Sun Sign: Gemini

Jared Padalecki is an American actor who has been open about his struggle with depression. The Always Keep Fighting campaign, which was launched by him in 2015, raised funds for To Write Love On Her Arms, a nonprofit organization that supports people struggling with addiction and depression. He also owns a '90s-themed bar called Stereotype, in Austin, Texas.

Recommended Lists:

15

Luke Wilson

(Actor)

35

7

Birthdate: September 21, 1971

Sun Sign: Virgo

A quintessential charming Texan, Luke Wilson stepped into films just like his two older brothers, Andrew and Owen Wilson. He initially focused on comedies, such as Charlie's Angels and Legally Blonde, but later deviated to thrillers such as Bad Seed. He is best known as Richie from The Royal Tenenbaums.

16

Alan Tudyk

(Actor)

24

4

Birthdate: March 16, 1971

Sun Sign: Pisces

Alan Tudyk is best known as Hoban "Wash" Washburne from the film Serenity and the series Firefly. He has also appeared in the films DodgeBall: A True Underdog Story, Knocked Up, and 3:10 to Yuma, has voiced characters in animated features such as Zootopia, the Ice Age movies, and Frozen.

Recommended Lists:

17

Steve Howey

(Known for His Roles as ‘Van Montgomery’ in TV Series ‘Reba’)

22

4

Birthdate: July 12, 1977

Sun Sign: Cancer

Steve Howey is best known as Van Montgomery from the comedy series Reba and as Kevin Ball from Shameless. He has also been part of movies such as Bride Wars and DOA: Dead or Alive. He also appeared in and produced the film Class, written and directed by his father.

18

William Gary Busey

(Best Known for His Role as ‘Buddy Holly’ in the Film ‘The Buddy Holly Story’)

23

5

Birthdate: June 29, 1944

Sun Sign: Cancer

Gary Busey initially performed as a drummer for country stars and used the pseudonym “Teddy Jack Eddy.” He is best known for his Academy Award-nominated role in The Buddy Holly Story and his countless character and guest roles in both movies and series. He also appeared on Celebrity Rehab.

Recommended Lists:

19

Chace Crawford

(Best Known for His Role as ‘Nate Archibald’ in the TV Series ‘Gossip Girl’)

23

5

Birthdate: July 18, 1985

Sun Sign: Cancer

Chace Crawford's journey from working as a car valet to becoming an actor in the film and TV industry has been quite inspirational. He also serves as an inspiration to college dropouts and to those who suffer from attention deficit disorder as he established a successful career after being diagnosed with ADHD and dropping out of Pepperdine University.

20

Randy Quaid

(American Actor Who is Known for His Roles in Both Serious Drama and Light Comedy)

31

6

Birthdate: October 1, 1950

Sun Sign: Libra

Randy Quaid is an American actor who received critical acclaim for playing President Lyndon Johnson in the 1987 television movie LBJ: The Early Years. Controversy's favorite child, Randy Quaid could not work for almost a decade due to legal troubles; Quaid has been charged with burglary and defraud among other illegal activities.

Recommended Lists:

21

Rip Torn

(Actor)

19

4

Birthdate: February 6, 1931

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Died: July 9, 2019

Rip Torn is best remembered for his Emmy-winning role of Arthur in The Larry Sanders Show and his Academy Award-nominated role of Marsh Turner in Cross Creek. Fans also loved him as Zed in the Men in Black franchise. He lent his voice to many animated films and video games.

22

Taylor Sheridan

(Best Known for Writing the Screenplay for 'Sicario' and 'Hell or High Water')

19

5

Birthdate: May 21, 1970

Sun Sign: Gemini

Screenwriter/director Taylor Sheridan is best known for his Academy Award-nominated original screenplay in Hell or High Water. He also gained fame as an actor, playing David Hale in the Sons of Anarchy and Danny Boyd in Veronica Mars. He has also written Sicario and written and directed Wind River.

Recommended Lists:

23

Ben McKenzie

(Actor)

20

4

Birthdate: September 12, 1978

Sun Sign: Virgo

Height: 5'8" (173 cm)

24

Karamo Brown

(Known for His MTV Reality Series the 'Real World: Philadelphia', The First Openly Gay Black Man on a Reality Show)

19

4

Birthdate: November 2, 1980

Sun Sign: Scorpio

A dynamic talk and lifestyle television host, Karamo Brown is also a reality television personality, actor, author, and an award-winning activist. Beginning his career with a small role in The Princess Diaries, he later switched to television, making his mark with the MTV reality series The Real World: Philadelphia. Also a published author, he has three titles to his credit.

Recommended Lists:

25

Henry Thomas

(Actor)

19

4

Birthdate: September 9, 1971

Sun Sign: Virgo

Height: 6'1" (185 cm)

26

Angus T. Jones

(American Actor Known for His Role as ‘Jake Harper’ in the TV Sitcom ‘Two and a Half Men’)

20

5

Birthdate: October 8, 1993

Sun Sign: Libra

Angus T. Jones is an American former actor. As a child actor, he gained international recognition for portraying Jake Harper in one of the most popular CBS sitcoms of all time, Two and a Half Men. Also known for his charity work, Jones has supported outfits, such as the First Star Organization, which helps neglected and abused children.

Recommended Lists:

27

Troy Baker

(Actor, Singer, Television actor)

18

4

Birthdate: April 1, 1976

Sun Sign: Aries

Height: 6'3" (190 cm)

28

Lucas Till

(Famous for His Roles in 'Hannah Montana:The Movie' ,'The Spy Next Door' and 'Monster Trucks')

19

5

Birthdate: August 10, 1990

Sun Sign: Leo

Lucas Till is an American actor best known for playing Havok in the X-Men movie series. He is also known for his portrayal of Angus MacGyver in the popular action-adventure television series MacGyver, for which he has received a couple of nominations at the Teen Choice Awards. Also a producer, Lucas Till has co-produced films like All Superheroes Must Die.

Recommended Lists:

29

Brigette Lundy-Paine

(Best Known for His Role as ‘Casey Gardner’ in the TV Series ‘Atypical’)

18

4

Birthdate: August 10, 1994

Sun Sign: Leo

Brigette Lundy-Paine is one of the few American actors who are genderqueer; they came out as non-binary in 2019, preferring to be addressed by they/them pronouns. Apart from being an actor, Brigette Lundy-Paine also co-founded an art publication called Waif Magazine and a vocal band called Subtle Pride.

30

Larry Hagman

(Actor, Director and Producer Known for His Role as ‘J. R. Ewing’ in the TV Soap Opera ‘Dallas’)

21

3

Birthdate: September 21, 1931

Sun Sign: Virgo

Died: November 23, 2012

Larry Hagman, son of actor Mary Martin, is best remembered as astronaut Tony Nelson from the iconic series I Dream of Jeannie and as oil baron J.R. Ewing from the long-running soap Dallas. He had also delivered several guest performances and dabbled in direction and production, before dying of leukemia.

Recommended Lists:

31

Isaiah Washington

(Actor & TV Personality Known for His Role as ‘Dr. Preston Burke’ in the TV Series ‘Grey's Anatomy’)

21

5

Birthdate: August 3, 1963

Sun Sign: Leo

Isaiah Washington is an American actor who achieved popularity after playing Dr. Preston Burke in the popular medical drama television series Grey's Anatomy. After learning about his African roots with the help of a genealogical DNA test, Isaiah Washington traveled to Sierra Leone where he touched the lives of many by building a school and donating supplies to a hospital.

32

Glen Powell

(Actor)

18

3

Birthdate: October 21, 1988

Sun Sign: Libra

Height: 6'0" (183 cm)

Recommended Lists:

33

Jesse Plemons

(Actor)

20

5

Birthdate: April 2, 1988

Sun Sign: Aries

Height: 5'10" (178 cm)

34

Powers Boothe

(Best Known for His Role in the TV Miniseries 'Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones')

17

3

Birthdate: June 1, 1948

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: May 14, 2017

Powers Boothe is best known for his Emmy-winning performance as real-life cult leader Jim Jones in Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones. He started as a Shakespearean actor and later played significant roles in Deadwood, Tombstone, 24, and Nashville. He has also voiced characters in video games.

Recommended Lists:

35

Brent Spiner

(Actor)

17

3

Birthdate: February 2, 1949

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Height: 5'10" (178 cm)

37

Dabney Coleman

(Actor)

18

3

Birthdate: January 3, 1932

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Died: May 16, 2024

Dabney Coleman is best known for his roles in films such as The Towering Inferno and The Beverly Hillbillies. He also delivered an Emmy-nominated role in Buffalo Bill and award-winning roles in Sworn to Silence, The Slap Maxwell Story, and Boardwalk Empire. He is also a skilled tennis player.

39

Nicholas Gonzalez

(Best Known for His Role as ‘Alex Santiago’ in TV Series ‘Resurrection Blvd’)

18

3

Birthdate: January 3, 1976

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Nicholas Gonzalez is best known as Alex Santiago from Resurrection Blvd. and Dr. Neil Melendez from The Good Doctor. Fans also loved him in Pretty Little Liars and Mental. He has also appeared in films such as Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid and is an avid poker player.

41

Tye Sheridan

(Actor and Producer Best Known for His Role as ‘Cyclops’ in the ‘X-Men’ Film Series)

20

4

Birthdate: November 11, 1996

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Tye Sheridan is an American actor best known for portraying the younger version of Scott Summers in the reboot X-Men movie series. Apart from being an actor, Tye Sheridan is also an entrepreneur and is credited with co-founding Wonder Dynamics, an AI production tools company, along with Nikola Todorovic.

42

Scoot McNairy

(Actor)

17

3

Birthdate: November 11, 1977

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Height: 5'9" (175 cm)

43

Travis Willingham

(Actor)

16

3

Birthdate: August 3, 1981

Sun Sign: Leo

Height: 6'4" (193 cm)

44

James Roday

(Actor, Director and Screenwriter Best Known as 'Shawn Spencer' in TV series 'Psych')

19

4

Birthdate: April 4, 1976

Sun Sign: Aries

Height: 5'9" (175 cm)

45

Robby Benson

(Actor as a teen idol in the late 1970s, appearing in the sports films)

16

3

Birthdate: January 21, 1956

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Robby Benson is an American actor, filmmaker, composer, singer, and teacher. He gained popularity in the late-1970s when he established himself as a teen idol, appearing in films like Ice Castles and One on One. Apart from being an entertainer, Robby Benson is also a fundraiser and activist for heart research.

46

Barry Corbin

(Actor)

17

3

Birthdate: October 16, 1940

Sun Sign: Libra

Height: 5'11" (180 cm)

47

Michael Dorn

(Actor)

16

3

Birthdate: December 9, 1952

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Height: 6'3" (190 cm)

48

Don Swayze

(Actor)

17

3

Birthdate: August 10, 1958

Sun Sign: Leo

Don Swayze is an American actor known for his work in popular films and TV series. Over the years, he has also appeared in several stage shows. Don Swayze is also an avid skydiver and cyclist. He races cross country mountain bikes during his free time. He is also credited with establishing Swayze Ranch, an animal therapy ranch in California.

49

Jake McDorman

(Actor)

17

3

Birthdate: July 8, 1986

Sun Sign: Cancer

Jake McDorman is best known as Brian Finch from the comedy-drama Limitless and Evan Chambers from the teen drama Greek. He has also played prominent roles in the sitcoms Are You There, Chelsea? and Murphy Brown, and been part of movies such as the Clint Eastwood-directed war drama American Sniper.
